intro: Romnalda papuana, commonly known as the Papuan romnalda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Romnalda papuana is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
